review: Very comparable to the Roku I already had. I bought this for a second TV, tried the Fire TV Stick due to lower price and the neatness of the plug in stick vs. the stand alone Roku box. It streams really well even though it sits in the next room away from the router and not in direct line of sight. The Fire Stick is just as easy to install and setup especially if you buy through Amazon. It comes pre-registered.  I also downloaded the Fire Stick app on my Android which comes in handy if you are surfing without sufficient light, the phone stays lit to see remote buttons better.After a quick learning curve in maneuvering the menus I was watching movies within 5 minutes of installation. I cant really find any negatives on anything yet even after several weeks. Very easy to use and overall just as happy with the Fire Stick as the Roku.

review: I was pleased with how quickly it installed and everything was setup within minutes. It streams well and we use it for Prime and Netflix streaming. I was a little nervous as our internet is not very fast, but it has not had any issues streaming content. My 4 stars is due to the fact that every once in a while there is no sound so we have to unplug it and replug back in to get the sound to start up again and the availability of free TV shows with Prime is crap. You have to pay for nearly every TV episode, but there are many free movies.
